title: Report: Victim shot in stomach by teens trying to clear jammed gun
content:
GAFFNEY, SC (FOX Carolina) -
The Gaffney Police Department said two teenagers are facing charges after a 19-year-old victim was shot accidentally.
According to the incident report, on Dec. 21 officers were dispatched to Mary Black Hospital where a woman in the trauma unit suffered a through-and-through gunshot wound to the abdomen.
Police said the victim told them the two teen suspects were in a vehicle when a gun discharged and struck her.
When officers interviewed the suspects, they said the minors were in possession of a Cobra semi-automatic .380 handgun. Christopher Foote, 17, was reportedly trying to clear a "stovepipe" malfunction, a bullet case lodged in the slide, when he accidentally fired.
After the victim was struck, the teen reportedly hid the gun under a building outside his girlfriend's home on Hardin Drive.
Foote and a second minor, Khalileel Wilkins, were both charged with unlawful weapon.
